soalib.driver

Class CP2110HidDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • soalib.driver.CP2110HidDriver

  • public class CP2110HidDriver
extends java.lang.Object
    This class designed to used Silicon Labs CP2110 chip sets, which is a HID class to UART IC. This chip does not emulate as keyboard, instead it presents as HID Class device, which generally represent that the communication between the HID and chip is by way or reports. Silicon Labs provides the drivers for this class in three OSes. This driver should work for all the OSes as long as the driver is able to load the driver DLL or shared objects.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ejaz Jamil, Soalib Inc.

        public static int getDeviceCount(int vid,
                                 int pid)
                          throws DriverException
        Gets the number of connected devices.
        Parameters:
        vid - Provide specific vendor ID, if known. Otherwise pass zero for all vendors.
        pid - Provide specific product ID, if known. Otherwise pass zero for all products.
        Returns:
        number of devices connected.
        Throws:
        DriverException

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String deviceid,
                    int baudRate,
                    int dataBits,
                    int parity,
                    int stopBits,
                    boolean flow)
             throws DriverException
        Connect to a device identified by the device id.
        Parameters:
        deviceid - a valid device ID. Valid device ID can be found by calling listDevices().
        baudRate - One of valid baud rates. Valid rates are: 9600, 19200, 38400, 57600 and 115200.
        dataBits - valid values are 5, 6, 7, 8. Typical is 8 bits.
        parity - valid values are 'N' = no parity, 'O' = Odd parity, 'E' = even parity, 'S' = space parity, 'M' = mark parity. 'N' is more common.
        stopBits - valid values are 1 or 2. 1 is more common.
        flow - for no flow control. is not frequently used.
        Throws:
        DriverException

      • read

        public byte[] read()
            throws DriverException
        Reads the data within the timeout period.
        Returns:
        an array of data read.
        Throws:
        DriverException

      • setReadWriteTimeout

        public void setReadWriteTimeout(int readTimeout,
                                int writeTimeout)
                         throws DriverException
        Sets read write timeout for the device. Default read timeout is READ_TIMEOUT and default write timeout is WRITE_TIMEOUT.
        Parameters:
        readTimeout - timeout in milliseconds.
        writeTimeout - timeout in milliseconds.
        Throws:
        DriverException

      • listen

        public void listen(java.lang.String deviceString,
                   DriverListener listener)
            throws DriverException
        Attach a listener to each device. This method should be called in a thread. The listener may be used to update GUI, etc.
        Parameters:
        deviceString - the identifier string returned by the device.
        listener - your custom listener. If listener is not provided (i.e, null, will print out the data on the console.
        Throws:
        DriverException

      • getProperties

        public java.util.Properties getProperties()
                                   throws DriverException
        Gets the product parameters as properties. The property names are available with prefix PROPERTY_ as constant.
        Returns:
        property object.
        Throws:
        DriverException
